newsitem.title: USA: Elcom unit signs $100 mln deal.
newsitem.headline: Elcom unit signs $100 mln deal.

text.p: Elcom International Inc said on Monday its personal computer remarketing unit signed a an agreement with Smith Barney, worth over $100 million in revenues over three years, to provide computer equipment.
Elcom said its Catalink Direct Inc subsidiary would provide Compaq Computer Corp personal computers for use in Smith Barney's offices across the United States.

"We believe this agreement is further validation of our PECOS electronic commerce technology which will allow Smith Barney to streamline its ordering process for the replacement of PC's and peripherals," Jim Rousou, Catalink Direct's president and chief executive officer said.

Catalink develops and licenses proprietary client/server transaction-based software systems. Elcom licenses this so-called PECOS technology to companies creating interactive electronic catalog and ordering systems.
